In addition, member stations must pay postage both ways on tapes
shipped to and from the Network. For a station in your area this
WOULD AMOUNT TO APPR0X IMATELY ^90.00 A YEAR IF YOU AVAILED YOUR¬
SELF OF ALL THE PROGRAMS MADE AVAILABLE BY THE NETWORK. (THERE
IS A STRONG POSSIBILITY THAT THERE WILL SOON BE CONGRESSIONAL
ACTION TO LOWER RATES FOR EDUCATIONAL RECORDINGS, WHICH WOULD MAKE
POSTAGE PAYMENTS CONSIDERABLY LOWER.) EVEN WITH THE POSTAGE CHARGES
YOU SEE THAT THE COST PER HOUR OF PROGRAMMING (FOR i|00 HOURS, OR
MORE) IS VERY LOW.
In ADDITION TO THE REGULAR NETWORK SERVICE DESCRIBED ABOVE, (a
sample Network offering is included in the material being sent
separately), we make available in-school programs to those sta¬
tions WHO DO IN-SCHOOL BROADCASTING. FOR THIS SERVICE A STATION PAYS
AN ADDITIONAL FEE OF ONE-FOURTH OF THE REGULAR ASSESSMENT, OR $2.00
PER REEL, WHICHEVER IS LESS, HOWEVER, SINCE MANY IN-SCHOOL STATIONS
ARE NOT ON THE AIR DURING THE SUMMER MONTHS, SUCH STATIONS ARE
ALLOWED TO SUBSTITUTE THE IN-SCHOOL PROGRAMS FOR REGULAR PROGRAMS
THEY WOULD RECEIVE DURING THE SUMMER, AND THUS PAY NO ADDITIONAL
FEE FOR THE IN-SCHOOL SERVICE. IF A STATION OWNED AND OPERATED
BY A SCHOOL OR SCHOOL SYSTEM PREFERS TO SUBSCRIBE TO ONLY THE IN¬
SCHOOL PROGRAMS, THEY MAY DO THIS UNDER A MODIFIED AGREEMENT. IN
TH IS CASE, THE STATION GETS ALL IN-SCHOOL PROGRAMS, PLUS ONE HOUR
A WEEK FROM THE REGULAR NETWORK OFFERINGS, FOR HALF THE FEE THEY
WOULD NORMALLY PAY FOR THE FULL SERVICE. OF COURSE, THE CONDITIONS
REGARDING POSTAGE PAYMENTS REMAIN THE SAME.
